title.rendered: Hide price for sold out products on Shopify’s Debut Theme

content.rendered:
Going out of stock is not the most pleasant experience we merchants can have but it happens to the best of us.

Additionally, depending on your ecom’s strategy, you may want to hide the price for your sold out products. Here is how you can do it.

Locating the file and adding the code

  1. In your Shopify admin, go to Online Store > Themes > Actions > Edit Code.
  2. Find the theme.css file in your theme. Keep in mind that depending on your theme’s version this file can also be named theme.scss.liquid or theme.scss.
  3. At the very bottom of the file paste the following code:
    .list-view-item .price--sold-out .price__regular, .list-view-item .price--sold-out .price__sale, .list-view-item .price--sold-out .price__unit, .grid-view-item--sold-out .price--sold-out .price__regular, .grid-view-item--sold-out .price--sold-out .price__sale, .grid-view-item--sold-out .price--sold-out .price__unit{ display: none !important; }
  4. Save the file.

Hide the price on the product page too

You can also hide the price for sold out products on the product page if you wish, it’s fairly simple.

  1. In your Shopify admin, go to Online Store > Themes > Actions > Edit Code.
  2. Find the theme.css file in your theme. Keep in mind that depending on your theme’s version this file can also be named theme.scss.liquid or theme.scss.
  3. At the very bottom of the file paste the following code:
    .template-product .price--sold-out .price__regular, .template-product .price--sold-out .price__sale, .template-product .price--sold-out .price__unit{ display: none !important; }
  4. Save the file.

That is it! Now the price won’t be showing up on your product page either.

Bonus: add a swipe slider to your product page

If you’re using Debut you may also want to take a look at the post we did the other day about how to add a swiping feature to product page images.

It’s a super easy 1 minute step that will improve your website’s User Experience maximizing the potential to increase your conversions since customers are so used to swipe on pictures and Debut does not give this option by default.

Click here to read how to add the code.
